Reviews.Title: “Good choice for both businesss and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Nikica_12
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with kind and helpfull stuff. Good value for money. Very good breakfast. The bathroom is too small, but clean. Room was quite simply furnished, but yet pleasant and clean. Bus stop is very close, journey to the city center takes about 30 min. Excellent choice if you have to visit Gemelli Clinic,hotel is close to the entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Roma”
Reviews.Author: Wene P
Reviews.Content: We absolutely recommend the Excel Roma Montemario. Gian Paolo at the front desk was such a GREAT help and very nice. This hotel is approximately 7 km from the centre of town, a perfect place to stay because it is out of the main hustle and bustle of town. The grounds here are beautiful, very peaceful and very nice. We highly recommend this hotel. Clean and very reasonable. If we ever come back to Roma we will definitely stay here again! Thanks to Excel for making our stay in Roma a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “the baker family”
Reviews.Author: bakersgraysessex
Reviews.Content: nice hotel lovely staff superior room was nice breakfast was really good bus journey 20 minutes away bus stop just little walk could not complain for money paid

Reviews.Title: “Clean and decent”
Reviews.Author: Mombits
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel as part of a tour group. It was a nice clean hotel and the lobby is very nicely appointed. The breakfast at this hotel was wonderful. I was expecting something much less than what we got. The bathroom is very small but still nice and clean. Some of the down falls are that the walls are paper thin. I could hear whole conversations going on in the next room. Also, the electricity left a little to be desired. I had brought my curling iron and a converter and it never did get hot enough to use. It was lukewarm at best. When walking in the corridor, sometimes the lights would go off for a few seconds- I think they may have been on a timer. The last complaint I had was that I could not get the phone to work properly to call internationally. One thing that was different for me but I gather is somewhat standard- you have to put your room key in a slot on the wall to get the electricity to stay on in the room. So you need to be careful not to leave it when you leave the room. Seemed to work fine, though.

Reviews.Title: “Really good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Harshybaby
Reviews.Content: Get at least a superior room - I sneaked a peek at one of the normal ones and its pretty basic. The hotel is nice and modern and with free wifi and breakfast included, its a good place to stay. The journey into the city centre will take between 15-30 mins depending on where you are going. (Vatican is 20 mins away). Travel tips from Fiumicino : Train will cost €8 each, buses are €4 each. Dont buy a bus ticket in the terminal - go to the terminal, and buy it there because you will get onto a Terravision bus quicker. Go to Termini and from here there are a few options: Get the Metro to Lepanto. Then get the 913 towards Stz MonteMario and get off at the right stop (check a map). Get the Metro to Cipro. Come out of the station and head towards the main junction by the fountain. Here you can get a taxi to the hotel (about €10), or go onto Via Trianfole for about 150m to the first bus stop and get either 907, 913, 990, 991. Try to get a bus map online or as soon as you get to a tourist information centre or alike.. buses are the way to travel in Rome as the Metro only has 2 lines. Enoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great staff(:”
Reviews.Author: frenchi4eva
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Excel Roma Montemario for the first week of the new year and I found it excellent. The staff here are absolutely amazing. The cleaning staff are very good at their jobs, and always smile and say hello when they see you. The breakfast staff are very efficient. And the receptionists are the best I have ever encountered. They all go above and beyond to help you. Gianpaolo was lovely! Always very polite, excellent at his job, and also very funny! Monica was fantastic and was very helpful in booking my visit to the Borghese Gallery. And another lady whose name I did not catch was wonderful! She went above and beyond to help me find out about the Epiphany celebrations at the Vatican, and was such a lovely, pleasant woman!!! And all the other reception staff were fantastic also. Always had a smile on their face and a hello on their lips. When I asked for another room the receptionists didn't hesitate to find me one, and I was moved within 10 minutes. I have not got a bad word to say about the staff here. They are simply the best. The hotel itself is very modern, clean, and spacious. It's surroundings are absolutely beautiful!! When you first get to Rome it is a bit of a challenge finding it. I strongly suggest looking at it on google earth. You can't see the hotel, but it shows you the opening of the road it is on, which will help tremendously. If I hadn't googled it, I would not have got off at the right stop. The best way I think to get there when you first arrive is to get to Termini from wherever you have come from, get the metro line A to Cipro, and when you come out of Cipro metro station take the stairs to your left, and then go left again and there is a small bus depo on your right. Catch the 907 and keep looking to your left. The stop to get off at is Trifonale - Scolopi. If you are unsure, ask the bus driver. They were always very helpful for me, although I never encountered one that spoke English, so have your phrasebook at the ready. When you are going from the hotel into Rome the buses 913 and 907 are probably the best. The 913 takes to to the Mausoleum of Augstus which is on Via di Ripetta, and is just a short street away from Via del Corso, which is the main street in Rome, and you can get to most everywhere from it. The 907 takes you to Cipro metro station where you can catch the metro to pretty much everywhere. Be warned though! The buses are normally packed with locals!! I strongly suggest that you choose this hotel because it was quite simply wonderful, and the staff here are amazing. I know I'm glad I did(:

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: emmajo87
Reviews.Content: First off - people need to understand that you get what you pay for! We paid £40 per night for our room, including breakfast, and were located a comfortable distance from the centre of Rome - a bargin! The hotel is extremely clean and tidy and has modern and tasteful decor throughout the communal areas. The outside terrance is lovely and surrounded by countryside, although it was too cold to enjoy in December! Our room was incredibly basic - a welcome pack of menus, phone numbers ect would have been appreciated, as would tea and coffee making facilities. However, we paid for a basic room - the slightly more expensive rooms looked lovely. Our room was cleaned daily, and we has fresh sheets and towels each time. I was basic, but it was adequate - you're in Rome, you will not be spending much time in the room! The restaurant was lovely. The food was some of the best we had during our time in Rome and the waiting staff were helpful, attentive and polite. The breakfast buffet wasn't fantastic, but was adequate and we certainly didn't go hungry. The reception staff were also very polite and helpful, assisting us when we lost the key to our case and providing helpful information about bus routes and the local area. The hotel is located a short walk from a bus stop that takes you straight to the centre of Rome - it's about a 30 minute bus journey but is only 4euros for a 24 hour bus ticket. In all, I would certainly stay at the hotel again. It was everything we required for our trip and the staff were superb.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad...”
Reviews.Author: StockportKaren
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for christmas 2011 with my two children. I feel that the problems we encountered could be rectified with the appropriate attitude. The GM (Monica) listened to our problems and upgraded our room,but I feel she needs a team to work alongside her,which unfortunately she doesn't have. We complained about several issues including noisy guests running up and down on the landing to our room which wasn't cleaned properly.Hence, dirty cups were left the following day, and toiletries and especially toilet paper. Also, they have a 'Do not disturb button' on the outside of the room, but is totally ignored by staff,as on christmas day when we wanted to be left alone, we were asked twice if they could clean our room. The most upsetting incident for us though as a family,was that when we went down to have our christmas evening meal together, the waitress who I must add is the only member of staff who smiles and makes you feel welcome, completely messed the dinner up. I ordered fish and was served a plate of lamb (which i don't eat). And at this point my children had eaten and finished, so I ended up not having a Christmas meal with them. On the whole and to summarise my review, the Hotel is a very grand building which could look and feel better, if the staff in the establishment made it feel more welcoming and made more of an effort. Sadly, we won't be returning and to be honest if the payment had'nt have been made in advance, we would have checked out sooner.

Reviews.Title: “when in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: BigFoodFan
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable, upscale hotel in the grand tradition of Rome. The hotel is completely updated and modern with courteous, helpful and friendly staff. Breakfast is a special event so be sure to eat there. The hotel is centrally located within walking distance of great restuarants and the important tourist attactions of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: gmillward
Reviews.Content: PROS - We arrived to be upgraded to the Junior Suite - Wow. We couldn't fault our accommodation it was 5 Star as can be seen on the professional photos provided by the hotel. The food and service was of a very high standard. Breakfast was varied and we even used the restaurant one evening, again I would give 5 Stars for very traditional Italian menu. You would have to pay at least an extra £200 to get the same quality in the city centre for a 3 night break. Taxi from Airport would have been £85, well worth it if you don't want the fuss of working out what train to get. We took the train and taxi, saving £50 (albeit very confusing) 3 days travel on the buses and metro only cost £11 each, great to get you to the main attractions. Opposite the Termini metro station is a open top bus tour operator. This is a must and a great experience. The hop on hop off facility made planning each day easy. Don't let the distance from the city put you off this Hotel. If you want a decent nights sleep in superior comfort at an affordable price and make your spending money go further, then this is a great choice. CONS - Whilst we were happy to travel daily by bus and metro to the City, it does take a day to get used to the travel routine. The trip to the city can take up to 30 minutes on a bad day in each direction. USEFUL TIPS: Fumichino Airport - Get the Express Train to Rome Termini only 30 minutes then get the Metro from Termini to the Cipro station using the main A line (RED) Catch the 901 or 913 to Montemario (probably best to get the taxi the first time from Cipro) When you book the open tour bus, pre-book and pay for the Vatican and Colloseum in advance, you don't need to queue on the day. MAPS Mmm - Street signs are not illuminated at night, it's easy to get lost after dark. Use a sat nav on your phone. No public toilets, but don't be afraid to ask in restaurants as the locals are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice break”
Reviews.Author: Tartanteaser
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very pleasant though quite a distance from the city. We made our daily journey into Rome part of the experience. We used the 913 bus from just around the corner and that took us right into the city's main attractions- journey time varied from 20 to 30 minutes depending on traffic and the buses were quite frequent. I would not advise anyone to drive into the city- Rome's motorists are nut-cases! At 1 Euro the bus journey was inexpensive! (We booked a taxi for 4 when we were going back to the airport- a journey which took 40 mins- the hotel receptionist was very helpful- and we got it at 40 Euro which was cheaper than we could find online!) Rooms are adequate and quite comfortable though dated- however the shower was a joke! One of our party is 6'4" and was unable to turn around in the shower as he kept turning the tap off whenever he moved! Upgrade if you can as there are better rooms available. Breakfast was fine with plenty to eat and a decent selection. We ate in the restaurant one evening- service was a little slow as there were only two staff waiting tables- however the food when it arrived was as good as we got in the city. It was our friends birthday during our stay and the manager sent up to their room a chilled bottle of bubbly with strawberries and canapés which was a lovely touch The pool area is nice but unfortunately was closed when we were there as it was 'out of season' Refreshments at the bar were reasonably priced and we found all the staff to be polite and friendly. All in all we had a lovely break and would use this hotel again. PS: Don't forget to pack mosquito repellent as I was bitten several times while enjoying an evening cuppa in the outdoor seating area!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pepperme
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about this hotel after reading the reviews on this site. But I'm so glad I didn't listen to them as our stay at the hotel was very relaxing, friendly and nothing was trouble for the staff. Just remember you are on holiday so slow your pace. We upgraded our room to the Junior Suite and is was very spacious, comfortable and a lovely bathroom. We went into the center of Rome by bus by using the €1 ticket that can be got just a 10 min walk away. Buses arrive very often and we stopped just around the corner from the Spanish Steps. We booked our taxi from the airport from taxi-airport-transfer.com to and from the hotel which I highly recommend. If you don't mind travelling into Rome or using taxis in and out (about €20 from central Rome) then this is a really lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect but isolated”
Reviews.Author: Aalahazrat
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in all aspects except that it was at a distance from the centre of the city. Helped me and my wife enjoy the walks to the bus stop and city and see life in Rome as people spend it daily.

Reviews.Title: “All in all great, but could do with abit of updating”
Reviews.Author: Izzy1000_11
Reviews.Content: Good points - great pool, lovely courtyard restaurant and the best cappuccino I've ever had! It's a lovely Roman building and it's a shame the rooms are decorated with dark modern wood and maroon velvet, it jars with the surroundings. It's about 20 minutes from the centre but the bus services are good, dropping you just near the Spanish Steps. The main downside was the breakfast, food often cold and miserable staff with the curtains drawn, could definitely have been better. The rest of the staff were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: GerardPC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is described on the website as being 15mins from the city centre and whilst this is true the location is not the most convenient. The intial journey from the airport was not straight forward, we abandoned the use of the metro as we were unfamiliar at this stage and used a taxi, but even he found it difficult to locate. Travel to the city every day was by use of the local bus and a connecting metro. This is the 15min journey referred to on the website. The hotel itself is modern styled on the 1st floor but the rooms on the rest of the floors are a little outdated and I was disappointed in the size of the bedroom, in particular the shower and the facilities (no tea/coffee and no ironing board) In fact my bed was missing a few wooden slats so the matress fell through The service in the resturaunt is great, pity that the menu stayed the same all week, it became difficult to find something new to try. The area around the hotel offers no entertainment value. If you are looking for a holiday by the pool then this would be a good hotel, but I would recommend a 1st floor room, and not the standard one. If you want a holiday sightseeing Rome, then choose somewhere closer to the city.

Reviews.Title: “A Terrible experience.”
Reviews.Author: EvangelosDynou
Reviews.Content: There are better places to stay in Rome. Don't stay there! As soon as we came to the hotel, they gave to one of our co-travellers the disabled room. we went and asked to change him to a regular room. the very very rood receptionist said that she couldn't do that, and that he should be happy cause that was the Superior room. what a bunch of lies! they gave us the disabled room and then instead of feeling sorry, they tried to convince us that was better. my friend (and relative) couldnt even use the toilet. after many fights, they gave him the next day another room, that had a broken shower, and caused to flood the room. The breakfast wasnt good. the bacon was surely baked over again and again. they use the previous days food. its better to get something from the supermarket. i asked for an adaptor to charge my camera, and they told me to go and buy one cause they didnt have. the rooms smell really bad, maybe its because of the airconditioning that seems like the filters were never cleaned. and the pool is not cleaned enough to swim. and i really want to point again that the woman receptionist is very rude. it doesnt feel like a 4 star hotel. their service is like a 2 star hotel maybe.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: adi_amp
Reviews.Content: Very cozy. Even if we thought we are so far away from the city center we were only 20 minutes away, the bus station is just around the corner. The breakfest was very good but every day was the same and that could be a problem if you stay there more than 4 days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - far from city cente”
Reviews.Author: DenmarkJan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Excel Roma Montemario in juli 2011. The hotel was nice and clean, and the facilities was good but the room was a little bit small. Only one thing was not as expected, the hotel told at the homepage that there was only 2 kilometer to Vatican city, but our GPS said 5 kilometer and that seems to be correct.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE WEBSITE PHOTOS ARE NOT TRUE STANDARD FOR MOST ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: chynagirl1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Montemario from July 4th to 7th we had a great break in Rome but things could have been better. Lets start the hotel and its grounds are lovely to look at and walk around, nicely decorated and really clean with no rubbish lying around the downside is that when you arrive at the hotel you have to climb quite a few steps (photo included) so not so good with a heavy suitcase. The reception staff were pleasant and helpful so no problems there. After seeing the hotel we were looking forward to seeing our room, what a shock we got, it was very basic and dated, cigerette burns everywhere. TV that had no English channels, mini bar with nothing in it a broken safe and bathroom that when you have a shower and you open the shower doors you have to sit on the loo to get out. The bed had a very dodgy blanket on it and myself and my husband received many bites which we believe came from the bed. They dont show you this room on the website. The hotel does provide free wi-fi but you must get passcode and login from reception. Breakfasts for me was very good toast, yogurts, cereals, cheese and fruit juice for my husband not so good scrambled eggs really slimy olive oil added to stop it drying out and it was the same for the bacon. There was also prunes, cold meats, cake, tea, coffee water and croissants. We did not try the restaurant as the menu was limited. The hotel pool is lovely and i really reccomend that you spend some time here, the pool is really clean with nice sun loungers, we did,nt have a problem getting a bed either. If the bedroom in the hotel matched the rest of the hotel i would have given it 4 stars overall but the premier inn (Manchester airport) that we had stayed in before we flew was 100 percent better. Also unless you are prepared to use public transport or pay 20 euros for a taxi each way the hotel is far away from the city centre. HINTS AND TIPS 1 Bus and metro travel is very cheap a 1 euro ticket allows you 1 metro trip and as many bus journeys you can manage in 75 mins this is the important bit buy tickets in bulk as you can not buy them on the bus and the kiosks are hard to find. we bought ours at the tabbaconist near hotel (good 10 mins walk) at the end of the lane turn right walk till you see church go right again and its at the end of the road. 907 bus takes you to Cipro metro station which is right next to the Vatican city. Approx 20 min bus ride. 2 buy your water at Carrefour 6 bottles1.20 euros, hotel 1 bottle 1 euro same bottle 2 euro in Rome centre. Carrefour at end of lane turn left walk till you see macdonalds cross road to macdonalds then follow road down 1/4 mile and its on your left. If you want to take some wine home buy it here it was more expensive in duty free. This supermarket has got everything you might need snacks/toiletries. 3 If you want to see the Sistine chapel and Vatican museums get there as early as possible we got there for 9am and there was no que to get in. We had tried to get in at 1pm the day before and the que was over 3 hours long. Ps its red hot in there so take water and a hand held fan you will thank me believe me. No photos allowed in Sistine chapel (we managed a sly few) but its ok to photo everywhere else. 4 Martini bar/restaurant near Colloseum is a total rip off. beware the staff will temp you in and rip you off. We sat down and asked for 2 large beers what they bought out was 2 tankers holding about 1 1/2 litres of lager each this cost us 30 euros. When the bill came the staff hang round to intimidate you. so you have to pay. 5 Buy a ticket for the 110 open red bus. It,s a bus that you can hop on and off at your leisure and it stops at all the main attractions. It runs from 8.30 am to 8.30pm. Look it up on the web www.trambus 6 Its free to get into st peters square and the cathedral, again go early to avoid the ques. No shorts allowed and shoulders must be covered. it costs you 5 or 7 euros if you want to go up to the cupola (that the dome). 5 euros if you walk all the way 7 you can take the lift and walk the last 250 steps. 7 In a restaurant if you order for example a steak a steak is all you will get, you will get no veg or potatoes these must be ordered seperately. So check with your waiter exactly what you get for your money. 8 The lane leading up to the hotel on a night is pitch black so be very carefull as cars speed down this lane.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is great but staff service is hit-and-miss”
Reviews.Author: wannacdworld
Reviews.Content: We had stayed for two nights in a suite which cannot be faulted, very spacious, nice beds / sofa beds, loads of closet space and two bathrooms. Though the place is quite far from the city, you'd have to get on a bus and the metro to go to the city center, it is near the Vatican museums which is also good. It is also quite far from any store so do take that into consideration. One of my beefs with the place is that in order to get to the reception--you'd have to go up quite a number of steps, difficult when you've got wheeled luggage. If there is any other way up, it wasn't obvious. There was free wifi - but it gets disconnected after 15 minutes and I would constantly have to log-in and start again. Night duty reception was not very helpful, we had checked in around midnight, started good enough but it was difficult to get any help. He had given us only one keycard, there were 4 of us, we had to go down twice to ask for it, and only then did he give another one. I understand the restaurant was closed but he could not recommend anything. We had reported that the phones in the suite weren't working, but he made it seem as if we couldn't read instructions and just weren't dialing properly. He didn't think to consider, why on earth would we be traipsing down to reception just to ask questions, if the phones were working. The day staff was a bit better but I would hope that they could do something about the service--if not for the beauty of the place--that stay would have been a real letdown.

Reviews.Title: “Great little escape outside of the city”
Reviews.Author: belladolcevita
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was great, the facility was well kept and modern. Nice pool outside although open starting in June and breakfast was terrific. Our room was comfortable and newly furnished, we enjoyed our 2 night stay here immensely. Also, complimentary internet for guests which is nice amenity when traveling.

Reviews.Title: “staff are excellent - friendly and attentive”
Reviews.Author: THenry_1833
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and we were very impressed by the friendliness of the staff. We had a medical emergency and they went out of their way to help, from calling the doctor to translation and providing extra stay for free. The relaxed atmosphere of the garden restaurant is excellent after a busy day in town. We will stay there again. Rooms are great value, considering that is one of the greatest cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Very good price/performance ratio, Bath room only 2 Stars”
Reviews.Author: Springstubbe Posted by a clever-hotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: By bus the Hotel is about 20 Minutes away from the city centre. Very well connected, every 10-15 Minutes bus frequency (various lines, 991, 913). 1€/ride/person. Service was quite friendly and professional, especially in the almost star level restaurant (ask for Massimo!). Our 4 star room was really fine, but the bath room has about 2 stars only (clean, but small, very limited equipment, looked like renovation was highly recommended). However, sufficient compensation was provided by the management. Very noisy during the early morning and late night hours, when guests (lots of groups) were in transit. We do recommend this Hotel for youngsters and families. Breakfast was italian style, not too much variations after 3 days somehow boring.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing!!”
Reviews.Author: ashley078
Reviews.Content: I booked a double room months ago and on arrival was given the disabled room on the ground floor opposite the lift, I complained and was then given a single room on the 3rd floor which was small and very basic.. I enquired about the air conditioning and was told it's opperative later in the year!! the room was very stuffy and of course noisey , this hotel has seen better days, it might look impressive (once you can find it!) but it is very over priced , noisey and very average well short of what you would expect from a 4 star hotel!! Breakfast is served in a room not big enough, and everything was cold, bacon scrambled egg, tea and coffee...croissants not fresh no fresh fruit ..rubbish !! Don't waste your money on this place!!! the staff were indifferent and not over helpful.. this place is one to avoid!!

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: travelerjane123
Reviews.Content: From outside you think this is going to be a nice hotel. It was rated 4 stars on the website we used to book the reservation. I was extremely dissapointed in this hotel. The room smelled like raw sewage. It was supposed to be double bed and we got 2 singles that were situated just so that we couldnt move them together. The matress was of such poor quality that we didnt get a good nights sleep. I had to keep the bathroom door closed because of the fumes of the bathroom. The shower head was so high up and the spray of the water went outside of the shower doors, not to mention that plastic on the doors were bowed and coming out of the tract so water was everywhere. I didnt pack shampoo because I was catching a flight home the next morning and the shampoo and conditioner provided smelled like flea shampoo for dogs. I was on the verge of tears when we left. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Generally a good hotel but can be noisey”
Reviews.Author: tmsfowler
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews about the hotel's location, we decided to book a taxi from the airport - the driver had no trouble finding it but we booked the taxi in advance. The hotel is exactly as the pictures show; clean and modern. The staff were all friendly and welcoming and there was plently of information about the busses and how to get to the city centre. Our room was large and comfortable with a wetroom and tea/coffee making facilities. Our first night wasn't great - I was woken in the middle of the night by the banging of doors, people talking in the corridoors and outside the hotel, and noise from above our room. The rooms are definately not soundproof and really lets the hotel down. Fortunately, the following 2 nights were peaceful (presumably from the departure of some of the noisier guests). The breakfast was better than most, with a variety of bread, cakes, cereals, bacon, eggs and fruits. Although there was a kettle in our room, the cream and milk was not replenished each day so we had to buy milk from the supermarket down the road. The buses are regular and run from up the road from the hotel to a station near the Vatican. We found this a nice way to travel but the bus back runs less regularly at night. We couldn't find a timetable anywhere, but it seemed like the 907 back to the hotel ran around every hour from about 8pm onwards. Tickets were bought from the newspaper shop about 10 minutes away from the hotel. We found this to be a generally good hotel, with clean and spacious rooms, good food and good staff. Unfortunately, it's location is a bit of a drawback, and should there be children or other noisey guests near your room, you're unlikely to get a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: triker55
Reviews.Content: after reading other reviews yes the hotels away from the center of rome but what do you want for just over £30 a night, all round good hotel better than some of these other chain hotels, romes a city where you walk about to see the sights pay a £100 a night to stay in the center or stay at the montemario , would i stay there again everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, just a little outside of Rome”
Reviews.Author: GavinH10
Reviews.Content: Gr8 hotel. Rooms comfortable and a gr8 restaurant. 14-20 euros into the centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Return to the eternal city”
Reviews.Author: Paolo9999
Reviews.Content: We got a very good deal here with Britain's favourite airline, considering that we needed to go at half term. Finding the hotel was easy, but we had looked it up on a map, and took our own satnav. About 45 minutes easy drive from Fiumicino and we were there. Ample free parking and on the level entry via the restaurant or the back door at floor 0. then up one floor in the lift to reception. We were made to feel welcome by the receptionist, who was at pains to answer any questions that we had about the location, where to go and how to get there. We had arrived a little early, but she contacted the housekeeping staff and allocated us a disabled room which we did not really need, but as nobody else needed it we took it because it was very close to the lift, had a "wet room" rather than a standard bathroom, and a view over the countryside. The room was east facing so caught the early morning sun, which explained why the windows were fitted with roller blinds, but unfortunately all three were broken. When we asked for them to be fixed, we were told that it was not possible because it was Saturday, but we could change rooms. Having looked at a few alternatives, we decided to stay put, but the hotel made it clear that we were welcome to change our minds. Apart from the lack of blinds, the room was comfortable, with flat screen satellite tv, a fridge, proper air conditioning (not the usual noisy hang on the wall units) and very fast but intermittent wifi. We had thought about using the hotel restaurant, but its menu was not terribly inspiring, and although modern and clean, there was little or no ambiance. That said, it was perfect for breakfast. A minor criticism was that the staff were not present all the time, and when things ran out they had to be requested. Apart from one member of staff, this did not go down too well. A downside of the "all you can eat" concept is that some people insist on taking far more than they can eat, even when they can see that there are people waiting behind them, and it is sad to see the high levels of waste that the hotel has to tolerate. The quality of the food at breakfast was excellent, and the staff continued to provide top ups on request for as long as there were guests in the room. Access to and from the hotel was easy, with people on reception duty at all times, and our late return from the city one hight did not present any problems. The local area does not have much to offer, apart from a busy McDonald's and some supermarkets to the left and a range of small restaurants to the right of the Via degli Scolopi. We were able to stock up with "picnic food" and cheap high quality wine for the following day from Carrefour, and there were several bars, Pasticceria(s) and take away food shops, but most were closed by 8pm. Overall, we would consider using the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great value”
Reviews.Author: amyh87
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a long weekend and once we found it we were pleased. The hotel is on the outskirts of Rome, but there is a bus stop 5 minutes from the hotel & there are three different bus routes you can take (907, 911, 913 - all signposted Trionfale) The service was good at reception, helpful with directions and in the restaurant most were nice. The breakfast was busy, would recommend going before 8:30 so you can get everything, they offer bacon, eggs, ham, cheese, cereals, yoghurts etc. Overall we had a lovely stay, although the location isn't central it's still easy to get to and you can be at the Vatican in 10-15 minutes and the Colosseum in about 30 minutes on the metro. The free internet and computer in the lobby is really helpful and an added bonus, as is the free map of Rome on Check-in. Would recommend and return!

Reviews.Title: “Terribly noisy hotel, as if there were no doors in the rooms.”
Reviews.Author: zanarini
Reviews.Content: Terribly noisy hotel, as if there were no doors in the rooms, but we paid for a room WITH door. Result: we couldn't sleep at all!

Reviews.Title: “Truly marvelous stay.”
Reviews.Author: nogrunch
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself, is a little out of the way; & difficult for some taxi drivers to find; whilst the flight of steps, leading up to the main entrance, was a bit daunting (especially for my 88yo mother). The rooms were clean & comfortable, without being luxurious. Breakfast was the usual buffet affair, nothing outstanding, but adequate. Dinners in the al fresco dining area, took on another guise in the warm evening air; with sometimes too much oomph to the background muzak perhaps. The dinner menu was quite broad, within its limitations; & the food was delicious & plentiful. What made this location so special was the friendliness of the staff, & the waitress (with the glasses), whose name I unfortunately neglected to note down, who made my mother & myself feel as if we were her only customers. She was so attentive & helpful, offering advice on the menu choices, & for her alone I give the hotel five stars. Three & a half to four stars without her.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, shame about location.”
Reviews.Author: Paulnewquay
Reviews.Content: The only major downside to this hotel is its location. there is no public transport to speak of to this hotel from the airport, so our only option was a taxi. There is a set price for a taxi from Rome Fiumicino to the city centre, but this hotel doesnt fall within the city centre. We had to pay about €50 each way. Also, as we didnt hire a car/motorbike, there wasn't a lot to see around the hotel. Everything else about the hotel was fantastic. The food was fantastic, the service was great and the rooms were very clean and tidy. The swimming pool area was great. Although you did have to wear a swimming cap in the pool for some reason. They do sell them at the pool bar for €5 if you haven't got one. There isn't a welcome pack in the room to tell you where everything is, so you just have to go exploring, but the place isnt huge so its not hard to find everything. There is a small supermarket at the top of the lane, and a Mcdonald's restaurant but not much else. Overall, the hotel is very nice, and is an ideal base if you have you own transport or if you just want to relax by the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Location sucks....service even more so”
Reviews.Author: bhaskar_desai
Reviews.Content: Location is suitable only if the sole purpose of your trip is to visit the Vatican. Otherwise centre of Rome is a long taxi and subway ride away. Service is poor. Housekeeping is arrogant...almost hostile. Looks like they don't want any visitors. Well we recommend you to stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel...just abit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Middlesbroughpair
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just as it appeared in the photos, modernly decorated, quiet and relaxing court yard with pool, but far out of the centre. We were well and truely 'done over' with the taxi from the airport, they wanted 95euros we got him down to 60, but going back was only 45euros! Room compact but modern and good room service. Breakfast nice. You could get to centre of Rome on 913 bus in 15 mins,911 to Vatican, enjoyed travelling that way. Take a swimming cap if you want to go in the pool, don't know why but you have to wear one. Some staff great some a bit off but overall a nice hotel away from the noise of the centre. Avoid room 101 abit noisey but hotel staff did ask guests to be quiet.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel poor location”
Reviews.Author: montyunitedkingdom
Reviews.Content: we picked this hotel because it had a swimming pool, only to told on arrival that it would not be open untill July. The hotel is situated 30 min by bus from the centre of rome.The buses in Rome are not the most comfortable in the world so you might like to take a taxi which will cost you about 20 euros.We would never have booked this hotel if we had known the pool would be closed.The hotel is very quite, the rooms average but clean. It has a very good restaraunt but the service can be iffey .Ask for MAX for best service. There are no nice restaraunts within walking distance of the hotel. If you are looking for a quite hotel out of town this could be for you .BUT NOT FOR ME.

Reviews.Title: “If you find it - you'll enjoy it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gl0beTrotter77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tucked away at the end of long alley with no signage whatsoever, making it difficult to find. Located 15-20 minutes driving from Vatican City. Large, clean rooms, helpful staff - Paolo was especially accommodating! Breakfast is basic (bread, cheese, cold cuts) but doesn't change from day to day. The only drawback was the location. Having a car is highly recommended if you like to stay out late. Buses run only till midnight. We drove into Rome center, dropped the car off and walked around.

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: mikeycee0630
Reviews.Content: had a great time staying at this lovely hotel. it's 15 minutes from vatican city and from there you can pretty much walk anywhere. if you're going to complain about walking ----> well ----> why travel? there are four buses that stop near the hotel and it was an easy ride to the city. the hotel was very quiet and our view from the fourth floor was very nice...highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, a bit out of the way...”
Reviews.Author: Claire289
Reviews.Content: The hotel and gardens are both stunning, well kept and clean. At breakfast, which is served til 10, an impressive buffet is produced and staff are keen to fulfil your needs. The restaurant at the back of the hotel is set in beautiful gardens and has nice food, though the bar closes about 10 and there are no other bars within walking distance. Reception staff were welcoming and helpful advising us how to get places. The hotel is about a 20 minute bus ride from the city centre and Vatican City. The bus gets very busy and is generally full of locals not tourists. However, though the distance from the city centre is advantageous to some, would look for a hotel more in the heart of it next time.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Vacation in Rome”
Reviews.Author: navyy2k
Reviews.Content: Vicinity to Rome is a twenty-minute bus ride; bus stop is a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel. Situated away from busy city center, but it makes it a nice get-a-way after a busy day of site seeing. The restaurant was excellent with very friendly staff- excellent tiramisu! The hotel staff was helpful and friendly. The rooms were very clean and had ESPN America (which replays NFL football games with no commercials!!!).

Reviews.Title: “Staff attitudes!”
Reviews.Author: JCNOxfordshire
Reviews.Content: The hotel was about 20mins outside of the centre of Rome but had good transport links into the city, 2 buses about 5mins walk from the hotel. The rooms are compact, and the bathrooms were tiny with a shower you could hardly turn around in. The really bad side of this hotel is the staff .... the 2 female receptionists were very good, smiley, and attentive but the remainder of the staff came across as arrogant and surly. There seemed to be no communication between the staff and you were told different things depending on who you spoke to. Breakfast, although included, was basic and if you came down at 9.30am (breakfast served to 10.30am) there would be no water, orange juice or coffee available and you would have to ask. If you are planning to use this hotel as a base only it is acceptable, if you like attentive staff and nicer rooms I would go somewhere different!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Good location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: ianmoore14
Reviews.Content: Travelled with 2 children and our suite had been recently refurbished, however some of the others rooms did look a little dated. Pool, grounds and restaurant were all excellent, however menu was a little limited.

Reviews.Title: “the best holidays ever!”
Reviews.Author: beautifulJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated rather far from the busy citycentre. But, in my view, this is one more point in favour of this hotel. Because we felt really relaxed and peaceful there after tiring sightsseing. Anyway there is no transport problem, the busstop is about 10 minutes walk from the hotel and you can easily get to any destination you want. Breakfast was not too rich(i mean the variety of food), but tasty and nutritious: eggs, fruit, cereals, tea, coffee, cakes, but no vegetables or salads. The staff - friendly and welcoming, always smiling and ready to help. The hotel in general is well- designed, clean, quite, modern and pleasant to stay at. Our room was rather spacious, bright, with high ceilings, large comfortable bed and soft pillows. There's air conditioning system so u can regulate the temperature in the room. The bathroom was clean, the towels were changed every day. Free internet access in the hall. Our room faced the beautiful garden in front of the hotel. You can have a meal either in the restaurant of the hotel or outside in the garden. We always had breakfasts and evening tea in the garden, enjoying the scenery. For sure, it depends on a company u go with! I had a very nice companion! But the hotel is really good!!! Suitable both for young couples and business travellers. Maybe for big companies of friends it would be lack of entertainment. Actually, I really have nothing to complain about! I have great memories about the trip!

HotelInfo.Name: Excel Roma Montemario
HotelInfo.Address: Via degli Scolopi 31, 00136 Rome, Italy
